text: Loved this movie. Definitely a rewatcher! 💜💜💜

Intro to this film is crazy exciting, with new moves for the species of foe I've not enjoyed before. This is shaping up to be a fun ride with our main character and his buddy, and I'm sure the comedy is only to keep the Horror lively. 
This ain't no spoiler, but they got my attention playing Body Count during a fight sequence. There is plenty of action, and it's gorily fun and also a blast to witness. There are plenty of laughs and a few unexpected giggles that I didn't plan. The action and mayhem are inspired, and the commradarie is also very commendable.

Day Shift (2022) is a vampire movie that doesn't delve into their story and focuses heavily on exaggerated but fun action scenes. The beginning of the film is very slow and drawn out, only after 30 minutes does the story start to improve.

Not all movies are made for Oscar awards.
If you can pass 2 pleasant hours with one, it's just fine.
And this movie manages to do that, effortlessly.

Entertaining, funny, good characters and story line. The plot could have been better developed around the vampire buying the properties and mixing the types of vampires together or that part of the story could have just been left out and the movie would have been just as good without loose/weak ends.
Overall fun film. I got into it and loved the world they built. But, it wasn’t that memorable.
It had a good cast with a unique story idea, but the movie wasn’t good and the characters weren’t that good either. Lasted only about an hour or so then turned it off lol

"Day Shift" delivers exactly what it promises: a super fun buddy flick that, while not breaking new ground, excels in its execution thanks to the infectious chemistry of its lead trio. Jamie Foxx, Dave Franco, and especially Snoop Dogg are an absolute blast to watch, making even the most familiar action-comedy beats feel fresh and entertaining. It's a movie that knows what it is and leans into it wholeheartedly, resulting in a thoroughly enjoyable ride.
It’s okay. Could have been better, but overall it’s not bad. Jamie Foxx has some really Crappy Films but this one isn’t bad. 3.3/5 or6.6/10
Fun vampire flick. Hoping for a sequel!
Day Shift was hilarious and full of insane action—Jamie Foxx, Dave Franco, and Snoop Dogg were such a great trio, we seriously need a sequel ASAP!
Very fun to watch, i was surprised by how much I enjoyed it. The movie is clever, it doesn't try to blow you away with sophistication, but leaves you feeling refreshed.
Day Shift’s action-comedy is a bit of a dud, despite its talented cast and intriguing premise.

It was fun. Not my favourite type of humor, but it was enjoyable. Sometimes it felt a little bit to gore and violent and some things felt extra. It's the perfect movie for a sunday afternoon, with rain outside and the will to watch anything. Not family friendly though.
Sit back and enjoy.
Cute and fun. Would recommend.
A bit of a different spin on the vampire movie bringing a fresh, humorous approach. Cast are great and movie has a feel good element to it

If you keep this movie light and don't try to explain it, dig into it etc. You watch it, its done and you move on. This is the best way or mood to have when watching the movie. I wouldn't say its a light movie, just your mood need to be light and don't take it too seriously. Because.... if you try to go deep and you might get angry. You have a lot of great pieces but you waste them. Was this a vampire movie, not really. Was it the normal guy with huge secret movie, not really. Its almost like Jurassic park and you have dinosaurs that live among us. Oh T-rex, and its just mundane thing. The first fight was awesome, the car chase was awesome but these are just flashes of hope in a fog you try to maneuver through. I can't put my finger on whether the movie didn't decide to pick a lane or maybe wanted to include all these things but they don't really matched together that well. Like I said - don't get too much into the movie. Watch it, done, move on and forget about it. It really doesn't stick that much in my mind to have something to make me recommend it to someone. Guessing that will be the case for most.

Me pareció muy interesante cómo “Day Shift” pasó de tener una presentación muy mala a un desarrollo y conclusión muy divertidas. Esta película invita a que en los primeros 10 minutos la dejes de ver, presentado con una escena de acción muy aburrida visualmente, con una iluminación extraña y con un montaje que hemos visto mil veces en cintas de este estilo, cortes frenéticos y una coreografía que no es ni dinámica ni sangrienta. Pero si soportamos los primeros 20 minutos de esta película, el resto es todo lo contrario a esta presentación, escenas muy bien filmadas cómo la persecución de carros o la escena en la que cazan un nido en una casa, son secuencias con mucha personalidad; aunque no terminan por opacar lo burdo del guion. Cómo no darse el tiempo de explicar porque el protagonista se dedica a lo que se dedica, porque esta organización busca exterminar a los vampiros si muchos de ellos parecen no tener nada de malo, actuaciones extrañas cómo la de Karla Souza que para mí mexicaniza un poco de mas a su personaje, y honestamente el conflicto a pesar de ser directo y siempre estar desarrollando al mismo (cosa que en serio agradecí) no es muy propositivo; pero reitero, siempre va directo al grano, aunque yo creo que podrían haber jugado un poco más con los trocos de información que sueltan los demás personajes, y que siento que el protagonista podría haber usado en el clímax de la cinta. 

Para mi donde el segundo acto empieza a ir cuesta arriba es en unir a la antagonista con el asesinato que el protagonista orquestó en su secuencia de presentación, me pareció un buen recurso narrativo de volver redonda a la trama, ya que el conflicto aunque podría sonar de una escala más alta, cómo querer que todo Los Ángeles sea territorio de vampiros, el plantear una venganza de Audrey “ojo por ojo” con la familia de Bud rememora de una forma realmente entretenida a las cintas de acción de los 2010’s; llegando hasta crear un suspenso muy orgánico; la cinematografía se vuelve más seria, dejando ese filtro colorido del primero y segundo acto y llegando a un punto climático con tintes de “final boss” en el que Bud después de aprender su lección y confiar en los demás junto a un equipo improvisado van por Audrey, reiterando un final súper dosmilero, y enserio agradezco que esta narrativa tan convencional de dicha época siga existiendo, me parece una estructura que en este género por más que veamos una y otra vez no aburre, porque es un planteamiento tan directo que es difícil no pasársela bien, cada momento está desarrollado dónde tiene que estar, es una escaleta de tres arcos marcadísima. 

Para mí “Day Shift” estuvo muy cerca de ser una película resaltable en las miles de cintas de acción que lanzan los diferentes servicios de streaming; tiene secuencias realmente buenas y omitiendo el por lo menos extraño primer acto y a una antagonista histriónica de más, es muy disfrutable, un elenco secundario aunque muy superficial llega a ser empático un único conflicto central que vuelve más dinámica la resolución del mismo y un Jamie Foxx que haga lo que haga es increíble. Una cinta con cosas muy rescatables para los fans que cómo yo amamos la acción, si, está lejos de ser una referente del género, pero para una tarde de aburrimiento es perfecta.
A fun time full of action, gore and laughs.

Vampiros raramente me apetecem, mas aquela cena inicial da vovó vampira numa luta extraordinária ganhou meu coração, os vampirinhos são fofos, muitos se assemelham a zumbis, e como eu amo zumbi já ganhou meu aí, o filme segue arrastado, a dupla Jamie Foxx e Dave Franco como Seth, o coadjuvante que dá uma levantadinha evitando o tédio, com boas tiradas cômicas, as únicas, salvam não o suficiente para se tornar inesquecível, mas para não ser esquecível… Torcendo para vampirinhos, menos mercenários
